intro: Gaultheria setiloba, commonly known as the slender wintergreen, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants such as blueberries and heathers. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of bell-shaped, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its berries, which are typically red or black, are edible and have a sharp, minty flavor. Gaultheria setiloba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
